titleStmt.title: Thomas M. Vincent to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG11565

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
1st Ky Cav
War Department,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, D. C., Jan'y 15. 1864.
His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky,
Frankfort Ky,
Sir,

I am directed to notify you that the disability resting upon Mr. George W. Sweeney, on account of his discharge from the service, as Captain of the 1st, Kentucky Cavalry, is removed and he is hereby authorized to re-enter the service if a new Commission be given him.

I have the honor to be, Sir,
Very respectfully,
your obed,t. servant
Thomas M Vincent
Asst. Adj't. General

13th C.
War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington D. C.
Jany 15th 1864
Vincent Thomas M asst a. Genl
George W. Sweeney (late of the 1s Ky Cavalry) is relieved of all disability and may reenter the service

Washington. D.C
Jany 15th 1864
Thomas M Vincent asst adj Genl
George W. Sweeny (late of the 1st Ky Cav) is relieved of all disability & may re-enter the service --
